p: Nucleoside analogs can interfere with cellular nucleotide synthesis pathways and terminate viral genome replication through accumulating mutations and cutting off the entry of natural nucleotides [83]. Since nucleosides and nucleotides are the basic components of viral nucleic acids, nucleoside analogs serve as viral RNA synthesis inhibitors in a wide spectrum of RNA viruses. With the view of the targeting ability toward RdRp, nucleoside analogs are responsible for viral RNA replication [84].
